A 35-year-old pregnant woman came to the OPD after she developed back pain radiating to the posterolateral aspect of the leg after lifting a heavy object at home. On examination, sensory loss was present over the anterolateral aspect of the leg, dorsum of the foot, and great toe. Medial Hamstring reflex was diminished with normal rest of the deep tendon reflexes. MRI picture is shown below. The most probable diagnosis is:
Identify the diagnosis:
Which nerve seems to be damaged in the given picture?

options.label: B
options.text: Tension band wiring with cancellous screws

questions.correct_answer: A. Tension band wiring with K-wires
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Tension band wiring with K-wires

questions.text: Identify the marked structure:
Paprika sign during debridement is crucial in management of which of the following condition?
Radio-resistant bone tumour among the following are: 1. Ewing’s Sarcoma 2. Osteosarcoma 3. Multiple myeloma 4. Chondrosarcoma 5. Lymphoma
Following an incised wound in the front of wrist, the subject is unable to oppose the tips of the little finger and the thumb. The nerve(s) involved is/are:

A patient with open wound with fracture of both bones of right lower limb came to the emergency. The doctor labelled the injury as 3B according to Gustilo-Anderson Classification. Which of the following would represent the injury?

options.label: A
options.text: Open wound with fracture with wound <1 cm

options.label: B
options.text: Open wound with fracture, 1 to 10 cm wound size, but mild soft tissue injury

options.label: C
options.text: Open wound >10 cm, though soft tissue coverage not required

options.label: D
options.text: Open wound > 10 cm, with extensive injury requiring soft tissue coverage

questions.correct_answer: D. Open wound > 10 cm, with extensive injury requiring soft tissue coverage
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Open wound > 10 cm, with extensive injury requiring soft tissue coverage

questions.text: Locking compression plating is commonly indicated in which of the following fracture types?

options.label: B
options.text: Transverse of oblique fractures of long bones

questions.text: Which of the following is an intra-articular fracture?
Weight allowed in skeletal traction is up to:

A 60-year-old female has a history of fever, fatigue, weight loss and polyarthralgia. She had morning stiffness and bilateral hand pain. The radiological findings are given below. What may be your diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Rheumatoid arthritis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The combination of symptoms like fever, weight loss, fatigue and the involvement of multiple joints, including the hands, is consistent with rheumatoid arthritis (RA). Radiological findings, such as joint erosions and periarticular osteopenia, are commonly associated with RA.
  • ➤ The combination of symptoms like fever, weight loss, fatigue and the involvement of multiple joints, including the hands, is consistent with rheumatoid arthritis (RA).
  • ➤ Radiological findings, such as joint erosions and periarticular osteopenia, are commonly associated with RA.

questions.text: Wrist X-ray shows:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Rickets

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ This given wrist X- ray shows rickets. The characteristic feature of rickets are thickening and widening of growth plate, indistinct and hazy metaphysis that is abnormally wide (splaying) with cupping or flaring (Brush-like appearance).
  • ➤ This given wrist X- ray shows rickets.
  • ➤ The characteristic feature of rickets are thickening and widening of growth plate, indistinct and hazy metaphysis that is abnormally wide (splaying) with cupping or flaring (Brush-like appearance).

options.label: A
options.text: Nerve injury is more common in anterior dislocation of hip.

options.label: B
options.text: Vascular injury is more common in anterior hip dislocation.

options.label: C
options.text: Posterior dislocation of hip is more common than anterior.

options.label: D
options.text: In posterior hip dislocation, attitude of limb is adduction, flexion, and internal rotation.

questions.correct_answer: A. Nerve injury is more common in anterior dislocation of hip.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Nerve injury more common in anterior dislocation of hip.

questions.text: Earliest way to detect development of compartment syndrome by a nurse in a patient with cast is:

options.label: A
options.text: Check radial pulse by displacing the cast

questions.text: A child presents with fever and discharging pus from right leg for 3 months. Following is the radiograph of the child. Identify the labelled structured:

A young marathon runner is participating in a marathon competition. After running for 100 m, he develops pain at the anteromedial aspect of tibia which was mild to start with, but increased on further running. X-ray was normal. The doctor ordered a bone scan. What is the likely diagnosis?
The most common organism causing osteomyelitis in drug abusers is:
A 30-year-old male presented with hip pain for last 6 months. Hip X-ray is as shown. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is a primary defect in Paget’s disease?

A 30-year-old woman presents with localized pain and swelling in her left knee. Physical examination reveals a palpable mass on the lateral aspect of the knee joint. Imaging Studies show a well-defined, eccentrically located lesion in the distal femur with cortical thinning and a characteristic “soap bubble appearance”. Biopsy of the lesion reveals the presence of giant and mononuclear cells. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 28-year-old male presents to the emergency department following a motor vehicle accident. He complains of severe neck pain and has limited neck movement. X-ray imaging of the cervical spine is performed and reveals the following findings. Based on the provided information, what is the most probable diagnosis for this patient?

A 55-year-old woman presents to the orthopaedic clinic with complaints of chronic low back pain and stiffness for the past five years. She describes the pain as dull and achy, predominantly located in the lower back, with occasional radiation to the buttocks and posterior thighs. The pain worsens with prolonged sitting or standing and improves with lying down. She denies any history of trauma or recent injury to the back. On further inquiry, she mentions morning stiffness lasting for about 30 minutes, which improves with activity. She also reports intermittent numbness and tingling in the left leg, particularly in the L5 dermatome distribution. Which of the following physical examination findings is most likely to be observed in this patient?
questions.correct_answer: A. Positive straight leg raise test

questions.text: A 65-year-old female patient presents to the emergency department with severe hip pain following a fall. An x-ray of the hip is obtained to evaluate for potential fractures. On examination of the x-ray, the radiologist notices a disrupted smooth curve along reference line. Which condition is most likely associated with the disruption of this line?
questions.correct_answer: B. Posterior dislocation of the hip
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Posterior dislocation of the hip

questions.text: A 50-year-old woman presents with pain in her shoulder that worsens at night, especially when lying on the affected side. She has limited range of motion, particularly abduction and external rotation. X-ray reveals narrowing of the subacromial space. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old male presents to the orthopaedic clinic with complaints of persistent knee pain and swelling for the past six months. He reports that the pain started gradually and is located along the medial aspect of his right knee. He denies any history of trauma or injury to the knee. The pain is exacerbated by activities such as climbing stairs or prolonged walking. On physical examination, there is tenderness along the medial joint line, and a palpable, firm swelling is noted in the same area. McMurray's test is positive for medial joint line tenderness and a palpable click with knee flexion and extension. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 13-year-old female presents with a painful swelling in her right leg. Imaging reveals a lytic lesion with an onion-skin periosteal reaction. Biopsy reveals small, round, blue cells positive for CD99. What is most likely diagnosis?

A 1-year-old male child has been brought to the outpatient department. His hand radiograph shows cupping, fraying, and splaying of ulna and radius distal metaphysis, and in metacarpals metaphysis. Which of the following statement is wrong about the lab values of this patient?

A patient presents with swelling and tenderness in the anatomical snuffbox after sustaining a fall on their outstretched hand. The image given below shows the cast used to manage the patient’s injury. Identify the fracture:

A female patient complains of tingling & numbness in lateral 3 ½ fingers. She usually wakes up in the night because of pain. She gets relief by hanging her hand at the edge of the bed. What is the correct pair of diagnosis and the clinical test that can be performed?
A patient complains of knee pain for last 3 months. There is no history of trauma. Following is her radiograph. What is the correct pair of diagnosis & management?

options.label: A
options.text: Avulsion fracture of patella – tension Band wiring

options.label: B
options.text: Fracture of upper pole of patella Cast Placement

options.label: C
options.text: Avulsion fracture of patella – Interfragmentary screw fixation

options.label: D
options.text: Bipartite Patella – Advise X-ray of other knee

questions.correct_answer: D. Bipartite Patella – Advise X-ray of other knee
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Bipartite Patella – Advise X-ray of other knee
